page.title: 13Beckhampton
page.content: Beckhampton is a hamlet with a roundabout through the middle. Not many people live there. There are two farms, a public house frequented by the racing fraternity especially stable lads and apprentice jockeys, and Jeremy Tree's racing stables. A large plantation of conifers "protects" the 28 or so houses. These houses are a mixture of old and new as is the population. Although a tight knit community the people of Beckhampton mix freely with those of Avebury through the primary school, the social centre activities and the Church. Despite the necessity to cross the dangerous A.4 trunk road the children of Beckhampton often go into Avebury to play with their peers.There are no shops in Beckhampton most people shop in Marlborough, occasionally Swindon or Calne.
